trans-unit.source: Create an Umbraco web app from the Marketplace in Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create an Umbraco web app from the Marketplace in Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Create an Umbraco content management system and deploy to Azure App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Create an Umbraco content management system and deploy to Azure App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: Create an Umbraco web app from the Marketplace in Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create an Umbraco web app from the Marketplace in Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Umbraco CMS is a fully-featured open source content management system that can be used to create a variety of applications from small to complex.
trans-unit.target: Umbraco CMS is a fully-featured open source content management system that can be used to create a variety of applications from small to complex.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Marketplace provides a wide range of popular web applications developed by Microsoft, third party companies, and open source software initiatives.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Marketplace provides a wide range of popular web applications developed by Microsoft, third party companies, and open source software initiatives.

trans-unit.source: The gallery allows you to create an Umbraco CMS app in just a few minutes by either applying the starter kits or by integrating your own design.
trans-unit.target: The gallery allows you to create an Umbraco CMS app in just a few minutes by either applying the starter kits or by integrating your own design.

trans-unit.source: This article showcases the Azure preview portal, which greatly simplifies resource management.
trans-unit.target: This article showcases the Azure preview portal, which greatly simplifies resource management.

trans-unit.source: The Azure preview portal is designed to speed your software delivery process by placing cross-platform tools, technologies, and services from Microsoft and its partners in a single workspace.
trans-unit.target: The Azure preview portal is designed to speed your software delivery process by placing cross-platform tools, technologies, and services from Microsoft and its partners in a single workspace.

trans-unit.source: Instead of using standalone resources like <link><linkText>Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link> Web Apps, Visual Studio Projects, or databases, you can create, manage, and analyze your entire application as a single resource group.
trans-unit.target: Instead of using standalone resources like <link><linkText>Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link> Web Apps, Visual Studio Projects, or databases, you can create, manage, and analyze your entire application as a single resource group.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you'll learn:
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you'll learn:

trans-unit.source: How to create a new web app through the Markeplace using the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: How to create a new web app through the Markeplace using the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: How to build a blog website by using Umbraco CMS
trans-unit.target: How to build a blog website by using Umbraco CMS

trans-unit.source: Create a web app from the Marketplace in the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: Create a web app from the Marketplace in the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: Login to the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Login to the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Choose the Marketplace icon.
trans-unit.target: Choose the Marketplace icon.

trans-unit.source: In the Marketplace , select the Web + Mobile tab, and then select Umbraco CMS.
trans-unit.target: In the Marketplace , select the Web + Mobile tab, and then select Umbraco CMS.

trans-unit.source: To create a new Umbraco CMS web app, click Create.
trans-unit.target: To create a new Umbraco CMS web app, click Create.

trans-unit.source: The next step is to configure all the resources associated with Umbraco CMS.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to configure all the resources associated with Umbraco CMS.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the resources are a web app and a SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the resources are a web app and a SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: First, select Web app to configure the web app settings such as the URL, App Service Plan, Web App Settings, and Location.
trans-unit.target: First, select Web app to configure the web app settings such as the URL, App Service Plan, Web App Settings, and Location.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure resources</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure resources</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now configure the database.
trans-unit.target: Now configure the database.

trans-unit.source: Select Database, and then choose Server.
trans-unit.target: Select Database, and then choose Server.

trans-unit.source: This example creates a SQL Server for the database on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This example creates a SQL Server for the database on Azure.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a SQL Server on Azure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a SQL Server on Azure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now that the web app and the database are configured, you can start deploying the application by clicking Create on the bottom of the first Umbraco CMS blade seen in the previous image.
trans-unit.target: Now that the web app and the database are configured, you can start deploying the application by clicking Create on the bottom of the first Umbraco CMS blade seen in the previous image.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click Create</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click Create</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After the deployment is completed, the portal will display the blade for your Umbraco CMS web app's resource group.
trans-unit.target: After the deployment is completed, the portal will display the blade for your Umbraco CMS web app's resource group.

trans-unit.source: In the Summary section, click the web app name to see the properties of your web app.
trans-unit.target: In the Summary section, click the web app name to see the properties of your web app.

trans-unit.source: Also in the Summary section, you can select the database resource to see the properties of the associated database.
trans-unit.target: Also in the Summary section, you can select the database resource to see the properties of the associated database.

trans-unit.source: Launch and configure your Umbraco CMS web app
trans-unit.target: Launch and configure your Umbraco CMS web app

trans-unit.source: On the details blade for your web app, click Browse to browse your web app.
trans-unit.target: On the details blade for your web app, click Browse to browse your web app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Browse to your site</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Browse to your site</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you browse the web app, Umbraco CMS initiates its installer wizard.
trans-unit.target: When you browse the web app, Umbraco CMS initiates its installer wizard.

trans-unit.source: Enter the information requested, and then click Customize.
trans-unit.target: Enter the information requested, and then click Customize.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install Umbraco wizard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install Umbraco wizard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter your connection and authentication details for the database that Umbraco will use.
trans-unit.target: Enter your connection and authentication details for the database that Umbraco will use.

trans-unit.source: Select Microsoft SQL Azure for the database type.
trans-unit.target: Select Microsoft SQL Azure for the database type.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain the connection string for your database from the Site Settings section of your web app.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain the connection string for your database from the Site Settings section of your web app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure your database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure your database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you are new to Umbraco CMS, you can select a starter website kit.
trans-unit.target: If you are new to Umbraco CMS, you can select a starter website kit.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, click No thanks, I do not want to install a starter website.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, click No thanks, I do not want to install a starter website.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install a starter website</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install a starter website</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Umbraco installer will complete the setup for your application.
trans-unit.target: The Umbraco installer will complete the setup for your application.

trans-unit.source: After your application has been configured, you will be redirected to the Umbraco CMS administrative dashboard.
trans-unit.target: After your application has been configured, you will be redirected to the Umbraco CMS administrative dashboard.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Umbraco CMS dashboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Umbraco CMS dashboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You will now create a sample text page that you will publish.
trans-unit.target: You will now create a sample text page that you will publish.

trans-unit.source: Select Content, select Overflow, and then select TextPage.
trans-unit.target: Select Content, select Overflow, and then select TextPage.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a text page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a text page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a title and some content for your text page, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Enter a title and some content for your text page, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: When you finish, click Save and publish.
trans-unit.target: When you finish, click Save and publish.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enter a title and some content</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enter a title and some content</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Wait while your page is published.
trans-unit.target: Wait while your page is published.

trans-unit.source: When publishing completes, you will receive a small alert on the bottom right of your screen.
trans-unit.target: When publishing completes, you will receive a small alert on the bottom right of your screen.

trans-unit.source: You can now browse the new content on your web app.
trans-unit.target: You can now browse the new content on your web app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Published web site page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Published web site page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: That’s it!
trans-unit.target: That’s it!

trans-unit.source: You've successfully created a blog web app using Umbraco CMS, in just a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: You've successfully created a blog web app using Umbraco CMS, in just a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <link><linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <link><linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the portal to the preview portal see: <link><linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the portal to the preview portal see: <link><linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.
